title: Discharging method (discrete mathematics)
summary: The discharging method is a technique used to prove lemmas in structural graph theory.[1]  Discharging is most well known for its central role in the proof of the four color theorem.  The discharging method is used to prove that every graph in a certain class contains some subgraph from a specified list.  The presence of the desired subgraph is then often used to prove a coloring result.[1]
